section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract states that the agreement begins on September 1, 2004, and lasts for a certain number of years and months which is redacted. The lack of a specified end date creates ambiguity and makes it impossible to determine the agreement's duration. This creates an in-text contradiction because there is no way to know how long the contract is which makes the obligations of both parties uncertain.

section: MANDATORY PRODUCTS shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times: [***** ] Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission. 2 1.[*****] 2.Sufficient [*****] to maintain total minimum of [*****] ADAMS GOLF [*****] (includes [*****])[*****] at all times 3.[*****] 4.[*****]
explanation: The definition of "MANDATORY PRODUCTS" is incomplete due to redactions. The contract states that the consultant must exclusively use certain Adams Golf products but fails to specify exactly which products are mandatory besides the language of 'Sufficient [*****] to maintain total minimum of [*****] ADAMS GOLF [*****] (includes [*****])[*****] at all times'. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the consultant's obligations, as the specific products he is required to use are not clearly defined. This leads to an in-text contradiction because the contract mandates exclusive use of 'mandatory products' without clearly defining what those products are.

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall be entitled to endorse and play the [*****]. The parties expressly agree that CONSULTANT may permit [*****] the use of CONSULTANT'S name and/or likeness in [*****] print and/or television advertisement provided that this is executed in a manner consistent with [*****] past [*****] advertising practice using similarly situated professional golfers with competing golf club endorsement agreements that include [*****]. If [*****] use of CONSULTANT varies from past practice of utilizing similarly situated professionals, CONSULTANT will take action to remedy the situation [*****]. If CONSULTANT participates directly in any [*****] sponsored photo shoots for advertising or PR, CONSULTANT shall wear his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. The parties further expressly agree that CONSULTANT'S endorsement of the [*****] shall not include the right to place a [*****] logo on his ADAMS GOLF [*****] or the ADAMS GOLF [*****]. If CONSULTANT'S relationship with [*****] terminates during this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall be permitted to replace the [*****] endorsement with another [*****] endorsement under the same terms and conditions expressed herein.
explanation: This section creates ambiguity because it allows the consultant to endorse and play a product that is redacted, which contradicts the exclusivity clause in Section 4 that prevents the consultant from endorsing products from other manufacturers, creating an in-text contradiction. This exception is vaguely defined due to redactions, making it difficult to determine the extent to which the consultant can endorse competing products and how it varies from past advertising practices of other professionals.

section: In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: This section outlines the minimum number of tournaments the consultant must play each year and the consequences for failing to meet that requirement, which is to repay Adams Golf a certain amount for each event under the agreed amount. The specific number of events is redacted, which creates ambiguity and makes it impossible to determine the consultant's precise obligations. This redaction creates an in-text contradiction by establishing a requirement for a certain number of events but failing to specify what that number is.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. The base compensation shall be paid upon completion of each calendar year of the contract.
explanation: The end date of the agreement and the base compensation amount are redacted. This creates a significant omission because it makes it impossible to determine the total compensation the consultant will receive over the contract's duration. Without knowing the contract's end date, which was also omitted in Section 1, the total number of years is unknown. This creates an in-text contradiction because the parties agree to a base compensation without specifying the total amount or the contract's duration.

section: In the event of termination of this Agreement, ADAMS GOLF shall cease using the name and/or likeness of CONSULTANT in advertising within [*****] days.
explanation: The timeframe within which Adams Golf must cease using the consultant's name and likeness in advertising upon termination of the agreement is redacted. This omission creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding Adams Golf's obligations upon termination. Without a specified timeframe, it is unclear how long Adams Golf can continue to use the consultant's endorsement after the agreement ends. This creates an in-text contradiction by outlining a requirement to cease using the consultant's endorsement but failing to specify the exact deadline for doing so.
